intro: Lomelosia pulsatilloides subsp. pulsatilloides, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
